original: Exhibit 10.7 CONSULTING AGREEMENT Aduro Biotech, Inc., with a place of business at 740 Heinz Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94710 (“Aduro”) and IREYA B.V having an address at Staalwijkstraat 16, 2313 XR Leiden, the Netherlands, represented by Andrea van Elsas, (“Consultant”) agree to all terms and conditions of this Consulting Agreement (“Agreement”) dated June 1, 2020, effective as of July 1, 2020 (“Effective Date”).
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.7 CONSULTING AGREEMENT IREYA B.V., represented by Andrea van Elsas, with a place of business at Staalwijkstraat 16, 2313 XR Leiden, the Netherlands ("Consultant"), and Aduro Biotech, Inc., located at 740 Heinz Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94710 ("Aduro") hereby agree to all terms and conditions of this Consulting Agreement ("Agreement") dated June 1, 2020, effective as of July 1, 2020 ("Effective Date"). However, it is understood that the primary responsibility for the interpretation and execution of this Agreement shall rest with Aduro.

This slight modification to the original clause shifts the responsibility of interpreting and executing the agreement from both parties to Aduro. This could potentially reduce the Consultant's involvement in any disputes arising from the interpretation of the terms and conditions of the agreement.

original: 6. Intellectual Property . Aduro shall be the sole and exclusive owner of, and Consultant hereby assigns to Aduro, any and all writings, documents, work product, inventions, developments, improvements, discoveries, know-how,  processes, chemical entities, compounds, plans, memoranda, tests, research, designs, specifications, models and data that Consultant makes, conceives, discovers or develops, either solely or jointly with any other person in performance of the Services (collectively, “Work Product”). Consultant shall promptly disclose to Aduro all information relating to Work Product as appropriate as part of the Services and at the request of Aduro. To the extent, if any, that Consultant has rights in or to any Work Product or any data or inventions developed in connection with work under this Agreement (“Aduro IP”), Consultant hereby irrevocably assigns and transfers to Aduro, and to the extent that an executory assignment is not enforceable, Consultant hereby agrees to assign and transfer to Aduro, in writing, from time to time, upon request, any and all right, title, or interest that Consultant has or may obtain in any Work Product and/or Aduro IP without the necessity of further consideration. Aduro shall be entitled to obtain and hold in its own name all copyrights, patents, trade secrets and trademarks with respect thereto. At Aduro’s request and expense, Consultant shall assist Aduro in acquiring and maintaining its right in and title to, any Work Product. Such assistance may include, but will not be limited to, signing applications and other documents, cooperating in legal proceedings, and taking any other steps considered necessary or desirable by Aduro.
ollama_generated:
6. Intellectual Property Assignment and Ownership: The Consultant grants Aduro a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, transferable license to use, reproduce, modify, distribute, and commercialize any and all intellectual property, including but not limited to writings, documents, work product, inventions, developments, improvements, discoveries, know-how, processes, chemical entities, compounds, plans, memoranda, tests, research, designs, specifications, models, data, and any other information or materials (collectively, "Work Product") that the Consultant creates, develops, or improves upon during the course of providing Services under this Agreement.

The Consultant agrees to promptly disclose all Work Product to Aduro as necessary for the performance of the Services and at Aduro's reasonable request. To the extent that the Consultant retains any rights in the Work Product or any related data, inventions, or intellectual property developed under this Agreement ("Consultant IP"), the Consultant grants Aduro a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable right to use, reproduce, modify, distribute, and commercialize such Consultant IP, without the necessity of further consideration.

Aduro shall have no obligation to acquire or maintain any rights in the Work Product or Consultant IP unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing by Aduro. However, if Aduro chooses to seek such rights, the Consultant shall cooperate with Aduro at Aduro's expense and provide such assistance as may be reasonably required, including but not limited to signing applications and other documents, cooperating in legal proceedings, and taking any other steps considered necessary or desirable by Aduro.

original: (a) Consultant is not subject to any other agreement that Consultant will violate by signing this Agreement; (b) Consultant has and shall continue to have the knowledge, experience, qualifications and required skill to perform, and shall perform, the Services in a professional manner; (c) Consultant to perform the Services in accordance with all Applicable Law; and (d) During the term of this Agreement, Consultant will not, directly or indirectly (whether for compensation or without compensation) engage in or provide consulting services, or enter into any agreement either written or oral, that would present a material conflict with any of the provisions of this Agreement, or would preclude Consultant from complying with the terms and conditions hereof. If during the term of this Agreement any situation or circumstance arises that might reasonably be expected to present a conflict of interest, or if Consultant might be unable to render Services or otherwise participate in such work without risk of breaching an obligation of confidentiality to another party, Consultant will promptly advise the Company’s General Counsel of the situation and Company and Consultant shall, in good faith, attempt to resolve any such conflicts(s). If requested by the Company’s General Counsel, Consultant will recuse herself from providing Services for the duration of the conflict.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Consultant is not bound by any prior commitments or agreements that would be in violation with this Agreement upon signing; however, the Consultant acknowledges that they may have obligations arising from other relationships that might require adjustment or termination to ensure compliance with this Agreement.

  (b) While the Consultant is expected to possess and maintain the necessary knowledge, experience, qualifications, and skills to perform the Services effectively, the Company recognizes that no individual is infallible and acknowledges its responsibility to provide reasonable support and guidance as needed.

   (c) The Consultant will adhere to all applicable laws when performing the Services. In case of any uncertainty regarding compliance with the law, the Consultant shall consult with the Company's General Counsel prior to taking action.

   (d) During the term of this Agreement, the Consultant agrees not to engage in any consulting services or enter into agreements that could potentially conflict with the provisions of this Agreement or impede the Consultant’s ability to fulfill its obligations hereunder. If a situation or circumstance arises that might reasonably be expected to present a conflict of interest, or if the Consultant believes they cannot comply with their confidentiality obligations without risk, it is the responsibility of the Company to provide alternative arrangements or adjustments to ensure compliance with this Agreement and avoid any potential conflicts. If necessary, the Company will relieve the Consultant from providing Services for the duration of the conflict.
